text: why does one get a different snippet when right clicking on the module name in the left directory sidebar than is in the usage snippet on the right sidebar?
left -- ```{% module "module_1553612107639373" module_id="7283571" label="Email Body - 1 Column thin" %}```
right --  ```{% module "module_1553612008551372" path="/Email Template Files/Email Body - 1 Column copy" %}```
just noticed needed to refresh page to get the correct usage snippet after updating the name of the custom module
as for why, I think they meant for it to be the same from both, but both are completely valid

Yeah, I know. I just was confused when I got a warning when adding to my email template. Noticed the difference. Problem was that the usage snippet doesn't automatically update when you change the name. Had to refresh the page
Okay - so here is a thing that would be amazing to have fixed. (or at least to understand why it is the way it currently is).
ahhh
Current, when you rename a custom module that already exists in a template or a page --- that new name does not carry through to the existing points of use
(dana is back)

<@UDFTHC6PK> I think originally it was done as a compatibility thing. But you’ll notice in drag n drop templates the modules have 2 names, one in parenthesis and one not. The one that is not in parenthesis is the “template” level name, so for example if you wanted a module to be called something specific to make it easier for the marketers to understand which is which, you can rename them.

This causes issues when trying to set up things for clients -- say I have a template with flexible columns that I've set up with the appropriate custom modules. However, because my project manager wants them to be renamed to better flow for the client --- this turns into me having to re-dump the modules into the template or pages in order for them to have the appropriate name
the name in parenthesis DOES get updated.
wait
what?
................. I will be right back after I search for this
sorry -- these are my custom modules
which are dropped into a flex-column module
As far as I'm aware, the page takes the file name when using a custom module in a flex module and there is only one point of renaming

<https://spin.d.pr/439zNt+>
in drag n drop templates I think it equates to the label attribute
OMG
MIND BLOWN.
hahaha
For some reason, I just assumed you couldn't rename those within the template

so to clarify if you want <https://spin.d.pr/acKAJR+>
yep
You just made me a much happier person

Hi all, is there a way to hide a module from appearing on certain blog posts? We have added an Image Gallery to the Design Manager for our blog post template, because many of the posts need to have a gallery of community images added. We have styled this gallery to have padding and a dropshadow. However, this padding and drop shadow is showing up on articles, even when no images have been added to the gallery.
*Example:*
Post with gallery: <https://blog.thebristal.com/national-gorgeous-grandma-day-in-armonk>
Post without gallery, but slider (and styles) are still technically there: <https://blog.thebristal.com/chappaqua-patch-the-bristal-at-armonk-resident-celebrates-100th-birthday>
<@UCDCS9KCP>
<@UCC8LGD43> add a boolean tag to the <head> use that to trigger the rendering of a <style> with css to hide that whole block if not true
and when you are ready to use the vscode extention:

probably wouldn’t matter much in the real world but HubSpot is there any reason the following couldn’t be combined into a single CSS file? would be one less render blocking HTTP request and google might like us a little more
or concatenated with our files

or even better host that public common css at a HubSpot url only.
Then we get the CDN effect and the http2 effect.

If your css isn't being combined, it's because there's a syntax error in one of your CSS files, you have inline CSS in your page or when validating the combined CSS of your page, we found that the page looks different somehow
we’re talking about HubSpot’s CSS not our own CSS, the layout.css and public common css
they all get combined together
hmm then it seems like that’s not happening consistently, I’m not seeing them combined on my sites
please share your sites and we can look at why. We also want to make it easier to self-diagnose.
ok I’ll DM you a few
